thread.title: Sacramento Kings 94, Trail Blazers 90: Live chat recap
thread.title_full: Sacramento Kings 94, Trail Blazers 90: Live chat recap | OregonLive.com

author: Joe Freeman | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Sacramento Kings 94, Trail Blazers 90: Live chat recap
text:
The Portland Trail Blazers fell to the Sacramento Kings 94-90 in an exhibition matchup at Sleep Train Arena.
It was the first road game of the season for the Blazers, who are opening a two-game trip that also features a Monday matchup against the Utah Jazz.
The Blazers and Kings opened the exhibition season with a game Monday night at the Moda Center and the Kings eked out a 109-105 victory in overtime. The Blazers led by 21 points in the game, but coach Terry Stotts did not play anyone more than 25 minutes and the Kings, who played some regulars extended minutes, stole a win with a late flurry.
Even with the loss, it's been an encouraging exhibition season for the Blazers, who have showcased a versatile and potent offense, surprising depth and good chemistry.
Will they take another step in the right direction? Can they continue to get a host of contributions from a variety of positions?
Jump in and share your thoughts about these questions and the game in the comments section below.
Visit OregonLive.com/blazers for a recap and more coverage.
